# kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Video Toolbox ](/documentation/videotoolbox)

- [ kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage ](/documentation/VideoToolbox/kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage)

-  kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage 

Global Variable# kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage

iOS 26.0+iPadOS 26.0+Mac Catalyst 26.0+macOS 26.0+tvOS 26.0+visionOS 26.0+

```
let kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage: CFString
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/VideoToolbox/kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage#discussion)

Initial delay of the VBV model between storing the picture in the VBV buffer model and decoding of that picture, as a percentage of VBV buffer duration.

This value should be specified as a number in the range of 0 to 100. Larger value increases the delay but results in smoother playback. Default value is 90, meaning 90% of the VBV buffer duration. This property key is incompatible with:

- kVTCompressionPropertyKey_AverageBitRate,

- kVTCompressionPropertyKey_DataRateLimits,

- VTVideoEncoderSpecification_EnableLowLatencyRateControl=True.
title: kVTCompressionPropertyKey_VBVInitialDelayPercentage | Apple Developer Documentation
